website_summaries.verdict: There is a lot of strategy packed into this little card game for 2.
pros: Puts two players in charge of rival kingdoms as they take cards to advance their kingdom's military, science, economy, and resources
With 3 different ways to win and a variety of strategies, it's easy to play this game over and over
With each game lasting only 30 minutes, you may even want to play it twice in a row
cons: Sorting the cards before each game takes some time, and the cards may show wear after multiple plays

customer_reviews.title: This game lives up to the hype!
customer_reviews.text: WOW! This is a great game! I have never played 7 Wonders and simply bought this game based on the reviews. There is a reason it is rated so high! It is awesome. The variability and mechanics of this game are great. The instructions are fair. I read them several times and there were a handful of times I had to consult Boardgame Geek for clarity. No big deal. The components are also very good. The only problem I have is my wife keeps beating me:) I highly recommend this game. If you are new to 7 Wonders, like I was, watch some tutorial videos on Youtube. I found them very helpful. This is my new favorite game!
customer_reviews.author: xBryMilx

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: I got this game as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend, and we couldn't stop playing once we started! Once you learn the rules, it plays fairly quickly and becomes intuitive. That said, there is a ton of replay ability since the game "board" changes each time you play based on how the cards are shuffled, which cards were removed, which wonders each player selected initially (based on what was available), etc. Would highly recommends this to anyone looking for a game they can play one-on-one with someone (seems like so many games these days require at least 3+ or even 4+ players).
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Great game to play every week
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband as he likes card games but ended up really liking it myself. The card art is great and it puts you on the edge of your seat hoping a card will or won’t be taken so that you can plan your strategy. The first game he was only 2 spaces away from beating me with military but I came back and was able to hold defeat off until victory points were counted. We have hundreds of games but this is one of the top to be played frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Very fun 2 player variant of 7 wonders
customer_reviews.text: I first played this game while on a work trip with a coworker. I was immediately hooked. the combination of chance and strategy in this game keeps it interesting every time you play. The chance aspect in the way that the cards are dealt out combined with the drafting mechanic makes this game similar to pick up sticks in the drafting of cards. That combines with the natural flavor of 7 wonders makes this game a hit for my home. My wife and I have this game permanently station next to our table for a quick game before dinner or before bed. We love it.
customer_reviews.author: nathan rigoni

customer_reviews.title: Good translation from the main game
customer_reviews.text: Good translation from the main game, it manages to keep the same concepts and applies them in slightly different ways. It plays very quickly and will keep your attention. The downfall of the game is how much time you spend sorting the cards for the different ages and manipulating the play area. The cards are not holding up to the amount of flipping we have to do to reveal them. It would be 4 stars if it came with sleeves or more durable cards.
customer_reviews.author: ToddW

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype!
customer_reviews.text: We purchase this game for our wedding anniversary, as 7 Wonders is one of the very few games my wife actually enjoys. Well, she enjoyed Duel even more! In particular, the ability to purchase any resource from the "bank" at any time allows for the game to flow and not be locked up just because your neighbors don't have a resource, as in the original game. We played many times on our anniversary cruise, and we now have many memorable experiences to remember. The variety of end game scenarios really makes for variability in game play and overall experience. I recommend it highly, even if you've never played 7 Wonders but would like to play a really solid 2-player game.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Ok game for 2
customer_reviews.text: It's abit complicated to learn and set up, but once through, it is clearer. We played 4 x and 3 of the wins were due to military or science overpowering the game. It's not a very satisfying outcome. I like our better when you count points. Its an ok 2 person game. I Like it, but think other games like forbidden island and patchwork are better balanced and more interesting.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett's mom

customer_reviews.title: Super fun and challenging for two
customer_reviews.text: I like the big 7 Wonders Board Game also, but almost like this better for two. It is just for two, and if you know the board game, this is pretty easy to learn. If you have never played the board game, I am thinking this will be a little harder to learn and so reduced my stars. Each time I've played it, it has offered new strategy opportunity. Can be played fairly quickly once you know it.
customer_reviews.author: Marcea Reid

customer_reviews.title: Competitive and fun
customer_reviews.text: My son and his wife played this game several times right after they opened it and loved it. It did take a couple of hours the first time to get set up and to read and understand the rules, but once they got the hang of it, the game would take about 30-45 minutes, as described.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Ham

customer_reviews.title: Great 2-player game
customer_reviews.text: Great game for those who love strategy but only have 2 players. Game has lots of ways to win. It is quick (30 minutes/game after learning it). It does not take too long to learn. Pieces and card feel like good quality. I feel like there aren't many good 2-player games. While this can't expand, it is a great game to add to your stable.
customer_reviews.author: Tortuga V.

customer_reviews.title: Fun two-player game
customer_reviews.text: We liked playing the original 7 Wonders. Since we also like playing 2-player games when not with friends, we gave this a try based upon a review I'd read. We highly recommend Duel. It is very similar to the original, but with very good adjustments for 2-players. One of our current favorite 2-player games.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fraley

customer_reviews.title: Best 2 Player Game!
customer_reviews.text: This game is wonderful. We messed up the rule about wonders at first and how resources work. We thought it rolled over so if you produce 2 wood and you don't use any, you have 4 wood the next turn...but then we re-read the rulebook again. We also didn't realize that Wonders abilities are activated right away. We waited a whole turn for "construction", but it makes sense that they're activated right away. Either way, super fun game. You can buy metal coins instead of using the cardboard ones for a more authentic feeling.
customer_reviews.author: William Schultz

customer_reviews.title: Very fun game!
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend and I read the instructions but we're unclear about a handful of things. There are a few YouTube video walkthroughs of the rules and examples, and that's really helped break down the complexities. This game is easier to understand if you've played 7 Wonders before as many mechanics are similar. Great game overall, I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Carlyon

customer_reviews.title: Great couples game, easy to learn
customer_reviews.text: My wife isn't a huge gamer, but she picks up on stuff fairly quickly. Her prior experiences includes games like Ticket to Ride (like the Nordic expansion), Dominion, Flash Point and some others. I had played the original 7 wonders, so we decided to give this a shot. After two nights of playing, we both really enjoy it. The game moves quick and still involves a great deal of strategy. Deciding whether or not to go for a military or science win (and forgo some points) or go heavy on victory points and play defense on the others. Overall, it's a great 30-minute couples experience if you both like this style of gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Arlie Rahn

customer_reviews.title: First game takes 2 hours to learn, then 30 min games. So fun!
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was overwhelmed reading through the directions. I played Catan, Dominion, Caracasson, etc. but for some reason it took me about an hour to read through the 20 page rule book. Then, I had to reference the rules many times the first game. The first game took about 2 hours, but we finally understood it all. Now, games take 30 min. It’s SO FUN once you learn the gameplay and what all the little icons means.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Luchauer

customer_reviews.title: Fun strategy game
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I play this quite a bit and love it, even though it angers me when I lose. Like table-flipping angry. I haven't actually done that because our table is really heavy and I don't want to lose the pieces. We usually play another game immediately after the first one. And since things can't end in a tie, we have to play a third game. We haven't invested in an expansion, but probably will in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Henderson

customer_reviews.title: Great game for two players!
customer_reviews.text: If you're familiar with the original 7 Wonders board game, it will be familiar to you but read the rule book carefully as there are a number of differences that can make a huge impact on how this variant is played. Its fast and fairly easy to pick up, especially after playing thru a couple of times but very engaging. Its highly likely that each playing session will be a unique experience. Considering there's very few good two player games out there, they put a lot of thought and consideration into making this one a fun and engaging experience.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Goodwin

customer_reviews.title: The perfect game for 2 people!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great two player game! I have never actually players 7 Wonders, but you don't have to to love this fantastic 2-player variant. I purchased this because most of the games in my collection are designed for 4 people and I wanted to start getting games that I couple play with my girlfriend or for the times that I'm just with one other person. this game is exactly what I was looking for. It's great that there are multiple ways to win. That aspect always adds more strategy to games, and gives more replayability!
customer_reviews.author: Tom K.

customer_reviews.title: Plays like a game of Civilization
customer_reviews.text: For all the Civilization PC gaming fans - this is the perfect board game for you. Lots of strategy, with an ancient Greek setting, and many different ways to win. The games can go on for a while, especially when you are new to the series and have to keep referring to the rules. My girlfriend is my primary gaming buddy and she likes this. 10/10 - great game!!
customer_reviews.author: Rastko

customer_reviews.title: I really like the way they incorporated familiar mechanics from the core ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why this game seems to be out of print already. I really like the way they incorporated familiar mechanics from the core game with the new features designed for duel play. Overall very enjoyable for two players. My fiancee enjoys this game as well. Just don't be surprised at the small size of the box! It's maybe 2/3 the dimensions of the core game, as the cards are tiny (maybe 2.5" tall by 1.5" wide). I probably won't bother sleeving this game like I normally do, as the game box insert holds everything very cleanly and the sleeves would probably prevent the cards from fitting in their slots.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Stansfield

customer_reviews.title: Most overrated game right now
customer_reviews.text: Regardless that I didn't get to play my own copy because the box came broken and returned it, at a local store I played some and the aesthetics don't cut it and the appeal is not there. Find something more of a "duel". Or play some DnD.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It’s reallyyyyyy good!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have played this Round 15 times now and it’s really fun! It takes a game or two to really figure out a good strategy and to keep it fast paced but it’s reallyyyy fun. I enjoy the concept of the game too, there are 3 “ages” and if no one has won by the end of the 3rd age, then you tally up points to see who one. But you can win before the 3rd age ends with either a military victory or a scientific victory. Games take Round 30 min give or take and it’s well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: David & Diana Nevarez

customer_reviews.title: A keeper for years to come!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a Christmas present and have really been enjoying it. It took playing twice to really feel like we got a handle on all the details and intricacies, but there are cheat sheets to help and the directions are well done. I especially like that you play in rounds-- it helps keep the play time to a reasonable length. It's a great way to get in some quality time at home with your significant other as it is only a 2 player game! And it is vastly different each time you play! Definitely a keeper for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: JARED G.

customer_reviews.title: 2 player improvement of the original
customer_reviews.text: If you like 7 Wonders, stop thinking about it and BUY THIS GAME. I LOVE the original, and think I like this game even more. It feels like in the original, there is too little interaction with your neighbors, especially beyond 3 players. This game introduces new ways to win, and has nail-biting moments where you hope your opponent doesn't draw the last military card they need to instantly win. I know this isn't as in depth as it could be, but trust me, if you love the original, this is a wonderful successor.
customer_reviews.author: Don R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 2 player game
customer_reviews.text: Takes the place of every trying to play 7 Wonders with 2 players that's for sure. Highly recommended if you even remotely like 7 Wonders. As far as general card drafting games it works well, and the imperfect knowledge of the cards in the deck make it interesting from a strategy sense, though I wish the had more like 10 cards removed from each deck instead of 3, would add some really interesting variability.
customer_reviews.author: C. McCann

customer_reviews.title: Best 2 player game ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best game ever!! Seriously, the very best 2 player game out there. I own around 300+ games, am an avid gamer geek and this is one of my favorites. Close to an empty nester now and looking for great 2 player games for hubby and I, and this one stands out and is out go-to game when we're hanging out alone. Great re-play-ability. Expansion pack is ok....base game is fun all by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best card drafting game for 2 players!
customer_reviews.text: The components and artwork are awesome, the gameplay seems to be competitively fun and endlessly replayable! Definitely a smooth blend of strategy and luck, but mostly the former based on my experience. Sole downside is a learning curve at the start for those new to card drafting board games.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I have been playing this a few times a week since we purchased it. It was a tad tricky to learn at first but now that we have gotten the hang of it, we love it! We have not played the original 7 Wonders so can’t compare, but this one is good.
customer_reviews.author: THB

customer_reviews.title: Easily the best version of 7 wonders.
customer_reviews.text: I take off a star because the minified cards can be annoying, and the wonder cards are just slightly larger than standard card size too, for no reason. Otherwise this is the best, most balanced game of 7 wonders you'll ever play.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Nice quick game
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a smaller game which could easily fit into a carry on, but still involved some strategy. This game is perfect! We take it on short trips and play it on our downtime. It's a fast game (an hour max), but interesting enough to play regularly, and easy to learn.
customer_reviews.author: Talb

customer_reviews.title: Great strategy game for 2- easy to understand and fun to play!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this game as we love the 7 wonders full version for 5-7 people. Been playing and love this game for 2 even more as the rule is not hard to understand, great instructions and the creativity of the game. The only thing we would recommend is that it would be great if there would be a short description about each of the wonder behind the wonder card. This would add to the education side and complete our satisfaction!!!! Would highly recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a game of 2!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Bui

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite 2 player game
customer_reviews.text: Before kids I never understood why anyone would want a 2 player game... After kids when my wife and I are sitting at home after they're in bed we can play Duel in about 30 minutes! It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Regan Reese

customer_reviews.title: Fills the void from the full-game two player mode
customer_reviews.text: Started off with the full 7 Wonders game and loved it, however, it is a bit tedious playing a third city (I can see how it would be interesting strategically, however, I like to just focus on my own city). That is where this game comes in. It clearly and fully fills the void of an unsatisfactory two-player experience in the full game, and does it excellently. I now shift between playing this and Carcassone with my gf.
customer_reviews.author: Patric Nordbeck

customer_reviews.title: The best 2 player game!
customer_reviews.text: We love this game! There aren’t many 2 player games my husband and I enjoy. This is our favorite. Great strategy options and you can change it up each time you play. The board and pieces are also good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Any fan of 7 Wonders knows the drastic falloff trying to play it with two players. 7 Wonders Duel not only solves the issues, but might actually be the better version of its larger parent! Perfect for any gaming couple!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Hose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2 players
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love 7 Wonders. The problem is it isn't design for 2 person play. When I first saw this I was hesitant to get it. I watched a few videos on how to play and then decided to go with it. It was way more fun than I had expected. While very similar to the original 7 Wonders there are small changes for two person play. One of the downfalls of the game though is if you plan ahead and devise a strategy, it is somewhat pointless as the card dwindle away. You can start to see your opponents next move and the cards you'll be face with. Still though it's a great 2 player version.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: One of the best 2 player games I have played
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy this game. It is both simple to learn and enjoyable. There is enough variety game to game to keep it interesting while still maintaining a balance where both players stand a chance.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 2 Player Game
customer_reviews.text: It's always difficult to find 2 player games but this one is definitely a winner. There's quite a bit of strategy that goes into this one and while like all games there is a luck factor, it at least is minimized. I definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a good 2 player game to play.
customer_reviews.author: JJ Lawley

customer_reviews.title: Love this game
customer_reviews.text: I love this game. It's a little complicated at first, but relatively easy to pick up. It just requires a bit of back and forth with the instructions because it's a lot to remember. The thing I like best is that the game changes each time you play, since you take cards out of the decks each time and can pick a different strategy. And it's nice that it's just a half hour game, so not too long.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: My #1 favorite board game
customer_reviews.text: Best board game I ever owned. I've played this game so many times against my friends, my brother, and even my girlfriend. In fact, this is our go-to couples game. I'd rather play this than any of my other board games, ps4, or pc games. I also prefer this over the original 7 wonders because the 2 player variant here is a lot simpler AND better than the regular 7 wonders. Also, most of the times I'm only with 2-3 people and we prefer to take turns playing this than 7 wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for couples
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas. We've played it a couple of times and it was a completely different game both times! The multiple win conditions keeps you guessing who's on the lead. Definitely the best two-player game I've played yet. Every mechanic makes sense and the strategy/luck ratio is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: LindsayBrist

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for couples
customer_reviews.text: Very replayable, my girlfriend and I keep coming back to it. After the first playthrough the rules are easy to remember and the setup is simple. We love that it's a game we can play sitting side by side instead of across from each other.
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Graham

customer_reviews.title: Awesome adaption for 2 players
customer_reviews.text: I love this game! We had already played the group version so it was a lot easier to learn the 2-player version, but it wouldn't be too bad for new players. I really like how every time you play is a little bit different based on what wonders you choose, and having multiple ways to win keeps both players on their toes.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Great two player game
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game for two people. Beautiful cards and boards. Game is just the right level of a challenge for two people. In this game you are trying to build up resources, to beat your opponent and build your monuments (7 wonders of the ancient world). There are many areas that are based on random selection to prevent the game from getting boring.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm and fam

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful 2 person version
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I were a fan of the original 7 wonders game, but it is hard to play the original with just two people. So we invested in this game, and we were not disappointed. It takes a minute to learn (as does the original game) but once you have the hang of it you can play a game rather quickly. It usually takes my husband and I about 30 minutes to play a round and we love that there are multiple ways to win. We highly recommend this game to other couples who love games.
customer_reviews.author: Branson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome 2 Player Game
customer_reviews.text: This game takes some serious rule reading to get started but is totally worth the effort once you play. It is an excellent two player game and a favorite of my husband and I along with Splendor. There are YouTube videos about how to play it you're not feeling like reading all the rules.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Same spirit as 7 Wonders but a different adaptation for 2 players
customer_reviews.text: Awesome game! It is different from the original 7 Wonders game, but optimized for two players and still in the same spirit. We like it enough to play it on a regular basis and not get bored. We also still play the original 7 Wonders with the two-player variant because the gameplay and strategies are different. Definitely one of the best two-player strategy games out there! If you like 7 Wonders, you'll love this!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Great game for 2
customer_reviews.text: Fun game for a couple! Highly recommend. This game is specifically made for only 2 people and they did a great job. There is a learning curve of about 1-2 games but that is to be expected for this type of game.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Fun game built for two
customer_reviews.text: I’d heard a lot of great things about the 7 Wonders games, and this one does not disappoint. It’s made for two players, so it feels very polished and tight in gameplay. My wife and I both enjoyed it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Ruby

customer_reviews.title: THIS GAME IS THE SH*T
customer_reviews.text: this game is the absolute SH*T we don't even play any other games any more. the bf is a master strategist and i am just a absolute ding dong when it comes to those types of things and i still manage to win occasionally, which is a shock considering he beat me at freakin monopoly 11 times in a row. i absolutely love this game so so so so much, i can't wait to buy the expansion, it's just an incredible two player game. SO GET IT
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Brown

customer_reviews.title: Super fun for 2
customer_reviews.text: This game is a lot of fun to play. My husband and I have played this game multiple times - it has enough going on that it never gets boring. There is a lot of information at first because you get started but it is very easy to learn and get playing quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Julie T

customer_reviews.title: It's different every time.  It's one of my all-time favorites.
customer_reviews.text: My 20 + daughter and I play this game along with the Pantheon extension. I love it. There are so many ways to win. Even if you think you've lost or won, when you get to the 3'd age all bets are off. So clever.
customer_reviews.author: bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love it! It's deep enough for a quick 2-player game that you have strategic options, but not so deep that it takes hours to learn to play. It's one of those that I can go back to after not having played for months and pretty much remember all the rules without wasting time relearning everything.
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: Great for 2
customer_reviews.text: Great for two people, a little extra concentration required when learning to play. My husband is always my second person for game night so we love trying to find good 2 player games.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: The best thing ever made
customer_reviews.text: The best thing ever made. Me and my friend loved the original 7 wonders but always had to play the 2 player adaptation, which is quite complicated. Now that "duel" is out we dont have to play on of our favorite games with a "ghost." This is a must buy for any gamer's collection.
customer_reviews.author: Charles UNCC Books

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: New to gaming and picked this up within 30 mins. I watched a video before hand. My wife thought it was fun too! Going to have many games with this one
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Complex and fun
customer_reviews.text: I've never seen a game that had so many ways to win. Takes a while to learn this one, but it's well worth the time spent! Lots of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Package

customer_reviews.title: Too complicated!
customer_reviews.text: Too complicated to start learning. Gave up after first set up. How is this supposed to be fun when you spend half a day trying to learn the rules?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Junkie :)

customer_reviews.title: Great game for 2
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a cozy fun game night with your partner, this is the game you should get! Unlike other games the setup is easy and fits in a small box :) The game itself is not oriented by lucks and there are multiple ways to win, which makes it very intriguing!
customer_reviews.author: LilaLager

customer_reviews.title: Best 2 player board game
customer_reviews.text: Great game, easy to play, each game can be played well within an hour. Duel is a fun card drawing strategy game for only.two players. The pantheon expansion is a great add on and gives even more versatility to your games. Great buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tonie

customer_reviews.title: 7 Wonders - Duel
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift. My nephew was very happy to get it. He is my niece's finance. Both of them love these kinds of games.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Friel

customer_reviews.title: Fun for 2
customer_reviews.text: This has become one of my wife and I ‘s favorite 2 player games. We had not tried the full version before purchase so a bit of a learning curve but now we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Super fun game
customer_reviews.text: This is a great 2 player game. There's a small amount of luck but there are multiple elements and strategy to the game that keeps the gameplay interesting each time. I have a lot of fun playing this game with my gf. Once you learn the mechanics of the game, they're about a quick 30 min per game so it's not a major time commitment every time. I tend to play more than one game once I start though. It can get addictive if you have a good opponent!
customer_reviews.author: Luke Rast

customer_reviews.title: Great version for two players
customer_reviews.text: This is a great two player version of seven wonders! The card setup for each round and multiple paths to victory introduce enough chance into the game to keep things interesting and provide players with the opportunity to play defensively as well as offensively. Enough similarities to the original game that fans of seven wonders should like it!
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: A good step up from your average family board game.
customer_reviews.text: A good 1 vs 1 board game. Great game mechanics, but a bit more technical than most board games. Got this after playing Ticket to ride, and noticed it was a grade higher in simplicity. Definitely requires a few rounds of playing to get the rules down if you opening it up for the first time.
customer_reviews.author: J Mista Mistaaaaa

customer_reviews.title: top of lists for a reason
customer_reviews.text: takes a minute to learn, but is easy and quick enough to play a game with my girlfriend after dinner, and also fun enough that we can play for a few hours. if you dont have a group, this is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: aDanByTheRiver

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 2 player board game!!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic 2 player board game. Better than 7 wonders itself! The game is very well balanced and very easy to learn (instructions are well written and the helper card/sheet is very useful!) in all, a great purchase and will be well played in my household
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Personally the duel version is better than the original
customer_reviews.text: We have the original 7 Wonders, too. Personally the duel version is better than the original. Please make it for 3 - 4 persons game. The rule and strategy is better than the original. One minor thing to improve is that the card and other pieces quality is not great. Too flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin & Hobbes

customer_reviews.title: Easy to learn, lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Very fun game. I never played the original but loved this one. The rules were easy to follow and learn and I had a great time playing.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: Great Game for Two!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I play this a lot together. It’s such a fun game and is a great rendition of the original 7 Wonders. I’d recommend it to have on hand when you don’t have a crowd but want to play something with a friend or your spouse.
customer_reviews.author: TaralynGoya

customer_reviews.title: Best Valentine's Day Weekend Ever
customer_reviews.text: Great 2-player game, not too difficult to setup/learn. Some of the language in the rulebook is a bit vague/obtuse, but YouTube can help fill in the gaps. Games take probably up to an hour, test your strategic thinking, and remains fun throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Tallman

customer_reviews.title: A great game!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband last Christmas and we're still playing it a few times a month. We love it so much that we actually got the extension as well which added a lot of depth to this already pretty strategic game. It's pretty easy to pick up and the re-play value is excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 2 player game!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic game! My husband and I have played 7 wonders for years, but never quite liked the two player variant. A friend told us about this game and we bought it in a second. It has been amazing! A great two player version of 7 wonders that fixes all of the issues with playing the original game with only 2 people. This game is quick (20-30 minutes per game) and very easy to understand if you've played 7 wonders. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Hugginkiss

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: It is very hard to find two player games, my brother recommended this for me and my husband and we love it. Very fun. My cat likes to mess up the cards but nothing against the game.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge

customer_reviews.title: Fun two player strategy game.
customer_reviews.text: Really fun, strategy heavy game. Its great for me and my husband because of the strategy. And also, there are different ways to win so sometimes we have no idea who is going to win until the end when we count up points. So rarely is someone playing the game from the beginning thinking they are definitely losing. Things can change easily in this game. It is a little overwhelming to learn at first. We watched a how it's played video on YouTube and that helped.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda

customer_reviews.title: A very fun game
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a present for my parents. We enjoy playing 7 Wonders as a family so this looked interesting for them to play as a couple. The game play is different from the regular 7 Wonders game while still having some of the same elements to make it a very enjoyable game.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Rathje

customer_reviews.title: Very fun game
customer_reviews.text: I love this game so much. It's a two player game, using the themes from the original 7 Wonders game (which is also really fun). There is a lot of replay ability in this game, because of the random layout of the cards in each play through. I would recommend to anyone who enjoys 7 Wonders original, and also think it's quite an easy game to be able to pick up for new players.
customer_reviews.author: K Grasher

customer_reviews.title: I love 7 Wonders
customer_reviews.text: I love 7 Wonders, yet never get it out onto the table because it is best with a larger group...so I was excited to try 7 Wonders Duel. It is great how they kept the charm of the original game yet tweaked it so that two players can enjoy the game. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Perry Young

customer_reviews.title: Super fun game for two players
customer_reviews.text: Great game for two players. I’ve now played the game about 6 times and it’s super fun to play. I’ve taught 4 others how to play it and they all took to it quickly and enjoyed it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Ross Avilla

customer_reviews.title: Birthday Present
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a birthday present for my partner. He loves it and we play all the time. Once we got the hang of the rules, it goes pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Kind of like if Agricola and Dominion had a baby.
customer_reviews.text: Kind of like if Agricola and Dominion had a baby. I haven't played the original 7 Wonders so I can't compare it to that, but on it's own it's very fun.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine

customer_reviews.title: Shipped fast.
customer_reviews.text: WOW Shipped as fast as it claimed. My Family is looking forward to play the game. Later on the days I’ll make sure to write an update about the Game itself.
customer_reviews.author: Dolores Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Duel captures most of the fun of 7 Wonders in a 2 player card game
customer_reviews.text: 7 Wonders: Duel captures most of the fun of 7 Wonders in a 2 player card game. It is very well done with some nice expansions. I have 10 or so plays with my wife, (she kicks my butt most of the time) and find it enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: TheCodeDawg

customer_reviews.title: Two player game for gamers
customer_reviews.text: Great two player game! Complex but not mind bending. Perfect after dinner game. Gamers will love it
customer_reviews.author: GaiasJewels

customer_reviews.title: Well balanced, fast and fun
customer_reviews.text: Excellent 2 player game based on best seller 7 Wonders. It's easy to learn and plays quickly but with plenty of scope for strategic thinking. It's also backed up by gat customer service. This is a card game with small, rather delicate cards (sleeves are highly recommended). A few of the cards arrived damaged and were cheerfully and speedily replaced by Asmodee, who represent manufacturer Repos here in the U.S.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Random

customer_reviews.title: Great Two Player Game
customer_reviews.text: It is really hard to find 2-player games, which my husband and I look for often. The game is a little tedious to learn at first but is a lot of fun. It has similar mechanics to a deck-building game.
customer_reviews.author: acaitlin

customer_reviews.title: Probably my favorite two player only game and might be my favorite ...
customer_reviews.text: Probably my favorite two player only game and might be my favorite overall game. Very well balanced. Very fun to play, and lots of different strategies once you fully understand the rules after a few playthroughs. Can not recommend this game enough
customer_reviews.author: Nick P

customer_reviews.title: I don't get the hype
customer_reviews.text: This game is a 2 player game and is... kind of boring. I really don't get the hype for it, seems mediocre at best.
customer_reviews.author: Sia

customer_reviews.title: Great 2 person version of a great game!
customer_reviews.text: Great game is made just as fun (or more) in a 2 person version. The BEST 2 person board game I've purchased or played. I'm heading out on a quick vacation with the family(literally as I write this) and I threw it in my carry on to enjoy. It's easy to enjoy a quick game (with game play typically around 30 minutes).
customer_reviews.author: Bruce K

customer_reviews.title: Good game, bad science
customer_reviews.text: If you like the original 7 wonders, you’ll enjoy this game for 2. Most of the game plays really well except for science. It’s all or nothing so you really have to commit but it’s far too easy for you opponent to derail your entire plan and leave you with nothing to show for it. Still, worth it overall.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Bell

customer_reviews.title: High quality game...lots going on
customer_reviews.text: This is a great game. It has a lot going on and yet is pretty easy to learn. You could play this quite a few times and have a different experience each time. I have never played the full 7 wonders game, but if it is like this, it's pretty good. It's a medium weight game (we tend to play lighter games more often) but a really good one.
customer_reviews.author: G. FarnsworthTop Contributor: Board Games

customer_reviews.title: Fun With Various Methods to Win
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite game for two players. I enjoy that you can win by various strategies, but having some luck still involved. My hubby and I have each won about an equal number of games, which is a big plus since he blows me a way with games heavy on strategy.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Maniac

customer_reviews.title: Fun for couples!
customer_reviews.text: We have a lovely time with this game! I got it for my husband's birthday because we love games the two of us can play together. I think it's fun! It provides enough challenge but it doesn't last all night. We were a bit confused by some elements, but after a couple games we figured it out. We've never played the full game but I'm thinking we need to get it!
customer_reviews.author: Chantal

customer_reviews.title: Great 1 vs 1 game
customer_reviews.text: 7 Wonders Dual is 1 vs 1 game famous for its ease to learn, variety of strategy and relatively short time period per game. This is the game you can play during lunch time and a short break from your work. I ordered through amazon one-day delivery because I suddenly wanted to play it with my friend. It was delivered without any problem for around $25.
customer_reviews.author: LKS

customer_reviews.title: Too much
customer_reviews.text: A lot of pieces and a lot rules. After reading rules setting it up we were too tired to play it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Beverly

customer_reviews.title: It is pretty complex at first
customer_reviews.text: An absolute blast of a time for two players. It is pretty complex at first, with a medium-steep learning curve at first, but once you understand the core concept it flows and works well!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan S.

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Very fun a little tricky to learn but once you have it it's hard to forget or mess up. YouTube is alot easier to learn from then the directions for us anyway. Will keep playing for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Vannessa

customer_reviews.title: Our favorite two player game
customer_reviews.text: This is our absolute favorite two-player strategy game. We have purchased five copies now and give them to couples as gifts. Such a great game and fun to play over and over.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: Fun game for two
customer_reviews.text: It takes some time to learn the instructions, but once you get it is a fun game.
customer_reviews.author: lia88

customer_reviews.title: Definite 2-Player Casual Game
customer_reviews.text: Great 2-Player card game. Came on time and is such a great game to play when there are only two people. Fun, interesting, and strategic. Things get competitive really fast but at the same time isn't as stressful as other competitive games. Great game for the money.
customer_reviews.author: ChaoticSeraph

product_meta.title: 7 Wonders - Duel
product_meta.description: One of the most celebrated games in the world can now be experienced in a two-player arena.7 Wonders Duel takes the game play and excitement of the original and adapts it for one-on-one battles. Take control of your civilization and decide to invest in science, military or prestige. Two New ways to win will keep you on your toes and watching every move your opponent makes. If you fail to build defenses your capital city may be destroyed, but ignore technology and your people may be left in the dark ages. It's a constant tug of war.7 Wonders Duel is an exciting New way to play the game that took the world by storm. Great for both fans of the original and those New to the hobby.
feature_bullets: Similar style of play as the award winning original, 7 wonders
Designed specifically for 2 player, head to head battles
Build a civilization that will crush your competition and flourish for centuries
